intro: Urostachys ringshausenii, commonly known as the Tibetan sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Tibet and adjacent regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. It produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
